page.title: 01DRAYTON AREA , INTRODUCTION
page.content: The village of{Drayton}lies about 5 miles from the centre of Norwich on the Fakenham road. A settlement has been on this site for many years,there being evidence of habitation from early {Saxon}times. Drayton was a popular stopping-off point for{Pilgrims}on their way to the shrine at{Walsingham, {Henry VIII}being one of the many royal pilgrims to stay here. The landscape varies from the arable farmland to the North to the Wensum valley in the South.Recently, the area has seen a large{housing {expansion}from Norwich,joining the villages of Drayton,Taverham and Hellesdon into one ribbon development.
